alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Eastern Kent; Newport; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Washington; Western Kent (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 09 at 3:07PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM EDT MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...All of Rhode Island, except for Block Island. * WHEN...From 2 AM EDT Monday through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of streets, urban and poor drainage areas. Rivers, creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several rounds of showers and thunderstorms are expected late tonight through Monday night. Storm total rainfall of 1 to 3 inches is expected across the watch area, but localized higher amounts are possible especially where thunderstorms develop and move over the same areas. Thunderstorms will have the potential to produce rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour, which will elevate the risk of urban and street flooding along with localized flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
